New Records: England beat Oman by 8 wickets in the T20 World Cup match on June 13, 2024, improving their net run rate to +3.08
Key Match Events: England's quick 8-wicket victory, Jos Buttler's 24 runs, Adil Rashid's 4 wickets, and the bowlers' dominant performance
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler chose to bowl first to manage the run rate, and England's fast bowlers set the tone with early wickets
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler highlighted the team's efficient performance and the importance of the win for their World Cup campaign
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's improved net run rate and their position in the group standings after the win
